content.content: A hospital can be a scary and strange place. It may look like a hotel, but it’s not! This app will help you and your family before, during and after a hospital visit. It has helpful reminders, checklists, steps, and resources to keep you and your loved ones safe. Doctors and nurses may use complicated and confusing words. Staff will wake you day and night. You may get new drugs, tests and procedures. Many different people will care for you or your loved one. [Tests and Procedures from the Mayo Clinic](http://www.mayoclinic.org/tests-procedures/index?letter=C) [5 Questions to Ask About Your Medications from the ISMP Canada](https://www.ismp-canada.org/download/MedRec/MedSafety_5_questions_to_ask_poster.pdf) [Who's Who in the Hospital by the Empowered Patient Coalition ](http://patientsafetymovement.org/wp-content/uploads/2016/02/Resources_Forms_Whos_Who_in_the_Hospital.pdf) Patients come to the hospital for planned surgeries, emergencies and treatments. [10 Things To Know For Surgery from the Empowered Patient](http://patientsafetymovement.org/wp-content/uploads/2016/02/Resources_Checklist_Ten_Things_To_Know_For_Surgery.pdf) __Use the Hospital Plan of Care form to advocate and ask questions about your loved one.__ [The Hospital Plan of Care form](https://patientsafetymovement.org/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/POC-Blank-April-19.pdf "The Hospital Plan of Care form") [Guide to Medical Care at a Distance](https://patientsafetymovement.org/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/Guide-to-Medical-Care-at-a-Distance.pdf "Guide to Medical Care at a Distance") ## Emergency Department Patients who come to the Emergency Department (ED) will go through the Triage process. ED doctors can‘t see all the patients at the same time. That is why the Triage process is used. ## Triage Patients are given a Triage level by a Triage RN based on their illness or injury. The Triage RN does a brief history and assessment to decide what Triage level the patient is. Most hospitals use 5 Triage levels. Triage levels[^1]: - Resuscitation - Emergent - Urgent - Less Urgent - Non-urgent Show the nurse or doctor a healthy photo of your loved one or yourself. They can compare this with how the patient looks now. Tell the nurse or doctor how the patient normally acts and the differences now.
